title: 6 Simple Steps to Changing Your Primary Email for a Microsoft Account

steps.title: Navigate to https://account.live.com/names/Manage.
steps.content: Navigate to https://account.live.com/names/Manage . Enter your original email address to sign in and click Next . If you don't remember that email address, click Sign in with Windows Hello or a security key to sign in without that information. After clicking Next, you will be prompted to enter the code sent to that email. If you don't have access to that email anymore, like it no longer exists, click Other ways to sign in so you can log in without that information.

steps.title: Click Add Email.
steps.content: Click Add Email . The button is located under the "Account" section. Microsoft refers to alternate emails or phone numbers as ‘aliases’. If you see that term, that is what it is referring to.

steps.title: Select “New” or “Existing” Microsoft alias.
steps.content: Select “New” or “Existing” Microsoft alias. If you want to make a new Outlook email address , click New and enter text that will be your new email address.

steps.title: Enter the email address.
steps.content: Enter the email address. Creating a new email will prompt you to enter the email name and select an email service from a menu. Using an existing email will prompt you to enter the full address into a text field.

steps.title: Click Add Alias.
steps.content: Click Add Alias . You will be taken back to the profile page and the new alias will be listed among your other emails. If the email address that you just tried to use is not listed, you either are trying to add an email address that is associated with another Microsoft account or you attempted to create an email that already exists. You can find out if your other email is already associated with a Microsoft account by going to https://account.live.com/username/recover and entering that email address.

steps.title: Click Make Primary.
steps.content: Click Make Primary . This will appear next to each alias listed on the account (except the current primary alias). The address you select will now be the one that appears in your avatar when you log into your account.
